body.p: Governor of Indiana. Salisbury, Indiana, native. Son of James Throck Morton and Sarah Morton. Married to Lucinda M. Burbank Morton. Attended Miami University of Ohio. Admitted to the Indiana Bar in 1847. Elected judge of the Sixth Circuit Court in 1852. Unsuccessful Republican candidate for governor in 1856. Elected lieutenant governor in 1860. Became Governor of the state of Indiana in 1861 when Henry Lane resigned following Lane's election to the U.S. Senate by the Indiana General Assembly. Reelected in 1864.
